info.title: POC - Clean Architecture Spring Multi Module

preface.bridgehead: API Guide from CA Spring Multimodule

chapter.title: HTTP verbs
chapter.simpara: CA Spring Multimodule tries to adhere as closely as possible to standard HTTP and REST conventions in its use of HTTP verbs.

entry.simpara: Used to create a new resource
Used to update an existing resource, including partial updates
Used to delete an existing resource

chapter.simpara: CA Spring Multimodule tries to adhere as closely as possible to standard HTTP and REST conventions in its use of HTTP status codes.

entry.simpara: A new resource has been created successfully. The resource’s URI is available from the response’s Location header
An update to an existing resource has been applied successfully
The request was malformed. The response body will include an error providing further information
The requested resource did not exist

chapter.title: Hypermedia
chapter.simpara: CA Spring Multimodule uses hypermedia and resources include links to other resources in their responses. Responses are in Hypertext Application from resource to resource. Language (HAL) format. Links can be found beneath the _links key. Users of the API should not create URIs themselves, instead they should use the above-described links to navigate

chapter.title: Index
chapter.simpara: The index provides the entry point into the service.

section.title: Accessing the index
section.simpara: A GET request is used to access the index

chapter.title: Customer REST Service
chapter.simpara: The customers provides the entry point into the service.

section.title: (POST) Creating customers
section.simpara: A POST request is used to access customer creation.

section.title: Request structure
section.programlisting:
POST /customers HTTP/1.1 Content-Type: application/hal+json;charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 145 Host: localhost:8080
{ "zip" : "000000-000", "number" : "123B", "city" : "Bay Bar", "street" : "Foo Street", "name" : "Foo Bar", "email" : "foo@bar.com" }

section.title: Example response

entry.simpara: The location of the created resource

section.title: CURL request
section.programlisting: $ curl 'http://localhost:8080/customers' -i -X POST \ -H 'Content-Type: application/hal+json;charset=UTF-8' \ -d '{ "zip" : "000000-000", "number" : "123B", "city" : "Bay Bar", "street" : "Foo Street", "name" : "Foo Bar", "email" : "foo@bar.com" }'

section.title: (GET) Retrieving customers by ID
section.simpara: A GET request is used to get the customer by Id.

section.title: Request structure
section.programlisting: GET /customers/55951aeb-4fc8-4ba4-b78a-020138b13d22 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/prs.hal-forms+json Host: localhost:8080

section.title: Example response
(GET) Finding customers by Name
section.simpara: A GET request is also used to find customers by name.

section.title: Request structure
section.programlisting: GET /customers?name=Foo%20Bar HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/prs.hal-forms+json Host: localhost:8080

section.title: Example response
(PUT) Updating customers
section.simpara: A PUT request is used to access customer update.

section.title: Request structure
section.programlisting:
PUT /customers/55951aeb-4fc8-4ba4-b78a-020138b13d22 HTTP/1.1 Content-Type: application/hal+json;charset=UTF-8 Content-Length: 145 Host: localhost:8080
{ "zip" : "000000-000", "number" : "123B", "city" : "Bay Bar", "street" : "Foo Street", "name" : "Foo Bar", "email" : "foo@bar.com" }

section.title: CURL request
section.programlisting: $ curl 'http://localhost:8080/customers/55951aeb-4fc8-4ba4-b78a-020138b13d22' -i -X PUT \ -H 'Content-Type: application/hal+json;charset=UTF-8' \ -d '{ "zip" : "000000-000", "number" : "123B", "city" : "Bay Bar", "street" : "Foo Street", "name" : "Foo Bar", "email" : "foo@bar.com" }'

section.title: Example response
(PATCH) Activate customer
section.simpara: A PATCH request can be used to activate a customer.

section.title: (PATCH) Deactivate customer
section.simpara: A PATCH request can be used to deactivate a customer.
